data.title: List of Films about prostitution in France
data.meta_description: The list "Films about prostitution in France" has been viewed 898 times.
data.text:
Irreversible 2002 film

0 0

Genre: Thriller, Drama, Crime, Mystery

Director: Gaspar Noé

Writer: Gaspar Noé

Events over the course of one traumatic night in Paris unfold in reverse-chronological order as the beautiful Alex is brutally raped and beaten by a s ... more »

Irréversible is a 2002 French experimental psychological art film written and directed by Gaspar Noé. Starring Monica Bellucci, Vincent Cassel, and Albert Dupontel, it depicts the events of a tragic night in Paris as two men attempt to avenge the brutal rape and beating of the woman they love. The film is told in reverse order, with each scene taking place chronologically before the one that precedes it.

2002 multilingual films · 24T

Films shot in 16mm · 95T

LGBT-related thriller drama films · 21T

The Oldest Profession 1967 film

0 0

Genre: Drama, Comedy

A collection of sketches that tells the story of prostitution through the ages. more »

rank #2 · 18 3

The Oldest Profession (French: Le Plus Vieux Métier du monde) is a 1967 internationally co-produced comedy film. It features contributions from six different film directors, each one doing a segment on prostitution through the ages.

1967 comedy films · 204T

Madame Claude 1977 film

0 0

Genre: Drama, Comedy

Director: Just Jaeckin

Supposedly true story of Madame Claude, who provided high-class call girls to dignitaries and heads of state... more »

The French Woman (French: Madame Claude) is a 1977 French drama film directed by Just Jaeckin and starring Françoise Fabian. The film is inspired by the life of French brothel madam Madame Claude.

Camille 1936 film by George Cukor

0 0

Genre: Drama, Romance

Director: George Cukor

A Parisian courtesan must choose between the young man who loves her and the callous baron who wants her, even as her own health begins to fail. more »

rank #4 · 29 8

Camille is a 1936 American romantic drama film from Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer directed by George Cukor, and produced by Irving Thalberg and Bernard H. Hyman, from a screenplay by James Hilton, Zoë Akins, and Frances Marion. The picture is based on the 1848 novel and 1852 play, La Dame aux Camélias, by Alexandre Dumas. The film stars Greta Garbo, Robert Taylor, Lionel Barrymore, Elizabeth Allan, Jessie Ralph, Henry Daniell, and Laura Hope Crews. It grossed $2,842,000.

Films scored by Edward Ward (composer) · 112T

Writer: Sylvie Verheyde

Set in London's world of high class call girls, Amoureux Solitaires tells the story of London based French escort Virgiinie, and Rupert, a man who rescues ... more »

Sex Doll is a 2016 drama thriller film, directed by Sylvie Verheyde, and produced by Bruno Berthemy, Bertrand Faivre, and Soledad Gatti-Pascual. The film stars Hafsia Herzi, Ash Stymest, and Karole Rocher in the lead roles.

Circle of Love 1964 film by Roger Vadim

0 0

Genre: Drama, History

Director: Roger Vadim

A bed-hopping coterie of soldiers, prostitutes, maids, actors, and aristocrats swap lovers amid the opulence of pre-World War I Europe. more »

rank #6 · 6 1

Circle of Love (Original French title: La ronde) is a 1964 French drama film directed by Roger Vadim and based on Arthur Schnitzler's 1897 play Reigen. The film generated minor controversy due to Jane Fonda's involvement, as she was one of the first major American actresses to do a nude scene in a foreign film.

Max and the Junkmen 1971 film by Claude Sautet

0 0

Genre: Drama, Crime, Romance

Director: Claude Sautet

A detective decides to go undercover and set up a group of robbers, but he may be getting too caught up in the task at hand. more »

Max et les ferrailleurs (US: Max and the Junkmen) is a 1971 Franco–Italian crime drama film directed by Claude Sautet. The film is based on the novel of the same name by Claude Néron.

Lafayette Escadrille 1958 film by William A. Wellman

0 0

Genre: Romance, War, Drama

American youth and flying ace flys for France in World War I; meets & loves a French girl & prostitute. more »

rank #9 · 2

Lafayette Escadrille, also known as C'est la Guerre, Hell Bent for Glory (UK) and With You in My Arms, is a 1958 American war film produced by Warner Bros. It stars Tab Hunter and Etchika Choureau and features David Janssen and Will Hutchins, as well as Clint Eastwood, in an early supporting role. It was the final film in the career of director William A. Wellman and is based on his original story.
